Thus, the difference between and is an interesting criterion to characterise the energy loss. Fig. 4b shows the impact of C-rate on and Ni-B shows the highest for all C-rates and the second lowest which results then in a higher energy loss than the NiFe-LDH samples. The energy efficiency loss L bat(Ni) related to the nickel electrode (dis)charge processes (calculated according to eqn (2) with C
C = 2 C
d ) corresponds to 2.9% for Ni-B and 2.3% for NiFe20 at 0.1C, when assuming a full cell charging with a of 1.6 V. For all C-rates the use of NiFe20 instead of Ni-B leads to a reduction of the energy loss of −0.4 to −0.7%, this represents a reduction by 12 to 24% compared to the Ni-B loss.
